AdvancedCaptureTasksTooltip.message:
Input capture tasks, which is a JSON object with following properties:
• bookId: The scrapbook ID to save the captured item into, when saving to backend server. Save to the current scrapbook if omitted.
• parentId: The parent item ID to insert the captured item into, when saving to backend server. Insert into root item if omitted.
• index: The position to insert the captured item at (starting from 0), when saving to backend server. Append to last if null or omitted.
• delay: Delay time before next capture task (ms).
• autoClose: Overriding option for how to auto-close dialog on capture complete. Available values are: “none”, “nowarn”, “noerror”, “nofailure”, and “always”.
• mode: The capture mode. “tab” to capture tab (auto-launch a new one for URL capture); “source” to capture source, and “bookmark” to capture as a bookmark. Defaults to “tab” if specified by tabId and to “source” if specified by url.
• options: Overriding capture options, as a JSON object, with the same format as the exported options (limited to “capture.*”).
• tasks: An array of capture tasks, with each element being a JSON object with following properties:
  • tabId: The tab ID to capture. Take url if omitted.
  • frameId: The frame ID of the tab to capture. Capture the main frame if omitted.
  • fullPage: Capture whole page if truthy; otherwise capture the selected area.
  • url: The URL to capture.
  • mode: Overriding task-specific capture mode.
  • options: Overriding task-specific capture options.
  • title: Custom item title. (when saving to the backend server) (ignored if “Ignore title” is checked)
  • comment: Custom item comment. (when saving to the backend server)
  • favIconUrl: Custom item icon. (when saving to the backend server)
  • recaptureInfo: Config for a re-capture, as a JSON object with bookId and itemId properties. (when saving to the backend server)
  • mergeCaptureInfo: Config for a merge-capture, as a JSON object with bookId and itemId properties. (when saving to the backend server)

BatchCaptureUrlsTooltip.message: Input a list of URLs to capture. One URL per line, with optionally a title separated by spaces.

CaptureDetailsCaptureInfoTypeTooltip.message:
This determines how to handle the captured content:
• Normal capture: Capture as a new item and insert into the target item.
• Re-capture: Replaces the content of the target item, update its item type, index, modified time, source URL, favicon, title, and comment, and attempt to copy annotations from the original page.
• Merge-capture: Merge captured pages and resources to the target item, and rebuild the interlinks. The target item must be site type (“depth to capture linked pages” has been 0 or more) and has been saved as folder.

CaptureDetailsFillDownLinkDocUrlFilterEx.message: Input a string or a regular expression string (/regex/flags) as the exclusion criteria to filter the current URL rules. Matched ones will be commented out.

CaptureDetailsFillDownLinkDocUrlFilterIn.message: Input a string or a regular expression string (/regex/flags) as the inclusion criteria to filter the current URL rules. Unmatched ones will be commented out.

CaptureDetailsOptionIndexTooltip.message: The position to insert the captured item at (starting from 0). Blank to insert at last.

CaptureTabBookmarkTooltip.message:
Capture each selected tab as a bookmark page or scrapbook item.

__MSG_CaptureTabDnDTooltip__

CaptureTabDnDTooltip.message: Tip: Drag this to the scrapbook to capture to a specific position. Hold Shift to capture source. Hold Alt to capture as bookmark. Hold Ctrl to capture with detail options.

CaptureTabSourceTooltip.message:
Capture the original content of each selected tab (before processed by the scripts).

__MSG_CaptureTabDnDTooltip__

CaptureTabTooltip.message:
Capture the current status of each selected tab. Only the selected range(s) is captured if there's a selection in the tab.

__MSG_CaptureTabDnDTooltip__

EditConfirmScriptedDocument.message: This page has scripts, which could conflict with the editor causing permanent data loss. Save anyway?

EditorButtonAnnotation.message: Annotation tool - Click to create a sticky note.

EditorButtonAnnotationLinkPrompt.message: Input the URL to attach the link:

EditorButtonDOMEraser.message: DOM eraser - When activated, click to erase the target element; Ctrl- or middle-click to erase elements except the target. (Erases can be reverted.)

EditorButtonEraser.message: Eraser - Click to erase content in the selected area; Ctrl- or middle-click to remove scrapbook markings in the selected area. (Erases can be reverted.)

EditorButtonEraserSelectorPrompt.message: Specify the CSS selector to erase elements:

EditorButtonEraserXpathPrompt.message: Specify the XPath to erase elements:

EditorButtonHtmlEditor.message: HTML editor - Click to toggle page content editing. (Edits cannot be undone after save.)

EditorButtonHtmlEditorCreateLinkPrompt.message: Input a URL to create the link:

EditorButtonLocate.message: Locater - Locate this item in scrapbook.

EditorButtonMarker.message: Marker - Click to mark the selected text. Click on a mark to create or edit annotation.

ErrorLocateNotFound.message: Unable to find a matching scrapbook item of this page.

ErrorLocateSidebarNotOpened.message: Unable to locate as no scrapbook is opened.

ErrorSaveLockedItem.message: Unable to save a locked item.

ErrorSaveNonHtml.message: Unable to save a non-HTML file ($URL$).

ErrorSaveNonUTF8.message: Unable to save a file with non-UTF-8 encoding ($URL$).

ErrorSaveNotUnderDataDir.message: Unable to save a file beyond data directory ($URL$).

ErrorSaveUnknownItem.message: Unable to find item of this page.

ErrorSaveUploadFailure.message: Unable to upload to backend server ($SOURCE$): $REASON$

ErrorTabDiscarded.message: Tab discarded. Reload it and try again.

ExtensionDescription.description: Description of the extension as it's visible to the outside world
ExtensionDescription.message: Capture web pages to local device or backend server for future retrieval, organization, annotation, and editing.

ExtensionName.description: Name of the extension as it's visible to the outside world

OpenScrapBookTooltip.message: Run a backend server and configure the options properly to get it work.

OptionAutocaptureTooltip.message:
Auto-capture is defined using JSON syntax with the following format:

  [
   {
    "name": "Example#1",
    "description": "Auto-capture example.com",
    "pattern": "/^https?://example\\.com//i",
    "delay": 5000,
    ...
   },
   ...
  ]

• name: a string to name this config and can be used for debugging identification, optional.
• description: a string to annotate this config, optional.
• disabled: disables this config when the value is truthy, optional.
• tabId: a tab ID to restrict this config to work for. Works for any tab when omitted.
• pattern: a regular expression string (“/expression/flags”) or an array of them. A URL is included by this config if matched by any of them. Includes any URL when omitted.
• exclude: a regular expression string (“/expression/flags”) or an array of them. A URL is excluded by this config if matched by any of them. Optional.
• delay: delay time before the auto-capture starts after the page completes loading (ms). No delay if it's omitted or not greater than 0.
• repeat: repeat interval for the repeated captures after the first auto-capture starts (ms). No repeated capture if omitted or not greater than 0.
• allowDuplicate: allow identical page be auto-captured repeatedly if the value is truthy, optional.
• taskInfo: overriding capture settings, with the same format as the main JSON object of “Capture as...”, optional.
• eachTaskInfo: overriding capture settings for each task, with the same format as each object in the tasks array of “Capture as...”, optional.

OptionCaptureAdoptedStyleSheetTooltip.message:
This determines how constructed stylesheets are handled. A constructed stylesheet is a stylesheet attached to the document by scripts.

• Save: Record constructed stylesheets in special attributes and create an initialization script to re-generate them on loading.
• Remove: Do not record constructed stylesheets.

OptionCaptureAppletTooltip.message:
This determines how APPLET elements, which are used to embed JAVA applets and are no more supported by most modern browsers, are handled. NOTE: JAVA applets may not work without original server environment, and could cause a security hazard.

• Save: Save the referenced resources to local.
• Link: Link the APPLET element to its source URL. Note that a network flow will be triggered when browsing the captured document in the future.
• Blank: Disable the APPLET element.
• Remove: Remove the APPLET element. Note that this could alter the web page layout.

OptionCaptureAudioTooltip.message:
This determines how audio elements are handled.

• Save: Save the referenced audio resources to local.
• Save current: Save the playing audio resource to local and ignore alternatives for other browsers. This considerably reduces size but the audio may be unplayable on another platform. If the captured page is not displayed in the browser (such as capture source), all audio resources are saved.
• Link: Link the audio to its source URL. Note that a network flow will be triggered when browsing the captured document in the future.
• Blank: Disable the audio.
• Remove: Remove the audio element. Note that this could alter the web page layout.

OptionCaptureCanvasTooltip.message:
This determines how canvas elements are handled. Canvases are blank initially and drawn by web page scripts.

• Save: Generate an initialization script that records the current canvas status to redraw it when the saved web page is loaded. NOTE: The current status of a canvas drawn using certain techniques cannot be recorded faithfully.
• Blank: Save a blank canvas.
• Remove: Remove the canvas element.

OptionCaptureDeleteErasedOnCaptureLabel.message: Automatically delete all erased content on capturing

OptionCaptureDeleteErasedOnCaptureToolti.message: NOTE: Even though the erased content is captured, external resources and some script-related interactive factors of it cannot be completely retained and reverted afterwards. It's generally recommended to erase after a capture to preserve such information better.

OptionCaptureDeleteErasedOnSaveLabel.message: Automatically delete all erased content on saving

OptionCaptureDownLinkDocDepthTooltip.message:
Capture linked pages (targeted by an A or AREA element or a meta refresh) whose depth is not greater than the specified value, and build cross links and record used resources. The main page is depth 0, pages linked by a page with depth 0 is depth 1, pages linked by a page with depth 1 is depth 2, ... and so on.

• Set depth to 0 to record used resources without capturing linked pages. Set depth to blank to not record used resources.
• NOTE: A deep capture may download a lot of data. It's recommended to set “save captured data as” to “Folder” to prevent a potential performance issue or error. Saving as single HTML is not supported.

OptionCaptureDownLinkDocUrlFilterLabel.message: Included URLs for capturing linked pages:

OptionCaptureDownLinkDocUrlFilterTooltip.message:
This determines what linked pages are for capturing according to URL.

• Each following line is a full URL (“#” and following chars will be auto-stripped) or a regular expression (e.g. “/^http://example\.com//”). 
• A link whose full URL (with “#” and following chars stripped) matches a rule at any line is included for downloading. For example, the link “http://example.com/subpage#h2” matches the full URL rule “http://example.com/subpage” or the regular expression rule “/^http://example\.com/SubPage\d*/i”. Any URL is included if no rule exists in any line.
• A line starting with “#” is regarded as a comment and will be ignored during execution.
• Text following a space is regarded as a comment and will be ignored during execution. For example, “http://example.com/ comment” is treated as “http://example.com/”; “/^https:/ comment” is treated as“/^https:/”.

OptionCaptureDownLinkFileExtFilterLabel.message: Included file types for downloading linked files:

OptionCaptureDownLinkFileExtFilterToolti.message:
This determines what linked files are to be downloaded according to file extension.

• Each following line is a rule, and a link whose full MIME type or file extension matches any rule is included for downloading. A rule can be:
  • A list of extensions separated with “,”, “;”, or spaces, regardless of case. For example, “jpg, jpeg; gif; png” includes “jpg”, “jPEG”, “Gif”, or“PNG”, and not “jp” or “jpgx”.
  • A regular expression string in the format “/expression/flags”. For example, “/jpe?g|gif|png/i” includes the same extensions as above. To include a file with no extension, use “//”.
  • A “mime:”-starting string, regardless of case. For example, “mime:text/plain” includes files with MIME type “text/plain”.
  • A “mime:”-starting regular expression string. For example, “mime:/text/.*/i” includes files with MIME type “text/plain”, “text/css”, “text/html”, etc.
• A line starting with “#” is regarded as a comment and will be ignored during execution.

OptionCaptureDownLinkFileModeHeaderLabel.message: Match HTTP header and URL file extension

OptionCaptureDownLinkFileModeTooltip.message:
This determines whether and how to download linked files (targeted by an A or AREA element element or a meta refresh).

• Disable download linked files: Do not download the linked resource.
• Match URL file extension: Determine whether to download according to the file extension of the URL. This performs better but cannot differentiate dynamically generated resource. For example, the file extension for the URL “http://example.com/api.php?id=123#sec1” is “php”, while the actual output resource can be html, doc, pdf, or other format.
• Match HTTP header and URL file extension: Traverse every link and determine whether to download according to its MIME type, extension of the output filename, and URL file extension.
  • Extension: Take the file extension corresponding to the Content-Type header if specified. For example, “js” is taken for “application/javascript”. (Match no file extension filter rule if there is no corresponding file extension for the header.) Otherwise take the file extension from the filename parameter of the Content-Disposition header if it's non-blank. For example, “ext” is taken for “Content-Disposition: attachment; filename="fname.ext"”. Otherwise take the URL file extension.
  • MIME type: Take the value of the Content-Type header (ignoring parameters). For example, “text/html” is taken for “Content-Type: text/html; charset=utf-8”. (Match no MIME type filter rule if the header doesn't exist.)

OptionCaptureDownLinkUrlExtraTooltip.message:
A list of extra URLs to be captured (“depth to capture linked pages” must be 0 or more) or downloaded (“download linked files” must non be disabled), regardless of interlinking and filters.

• Each following line is a full URL (“#” and following chars will be auto-stripped).
• A line starting with “#” is regarded as a comment and will be ignored during execution.
• Text following a space is regarded as a comment and will be ignored during execution. For example, “http://example.com/ comment” is treated as “http://example.com/”.

OptionCaptureDownLinkUrlFilterTooltip.message:
This determines what links are forbidden for downloading or capturing according to URL. NOTE: Certain sites make interactive commands as plain hyperlink, which could be unexpectedly triggered during traversal and cause something like logging out the site. This filter can be configured to avoid such issue.

• Each following line is a full URL (“#” and following chars will be auto-stripped) or a regular expression (e.g. “/[/=]logout\b/i”). 
• A link whose full URL (with “#” and following chars stripped) matches a rule at any line is forbidden for downloading. For example, the links “http://example.com/logout” and “http://example.com/?a=LOGOUT” both match the regular expression rule “/[/=]logout\b/i”.
• A line starting with “#” is regarded as a comment and will be ignored during execution.
• Text following a space is regarded as a comment and will be ignored during execution. For example, “http://example.com/ comment” is treated as “http://example.com/”; “/^https:/ comment” is treated as“/^https:/”.

OptionCaptureEmbedTooltip.message:
This determines how EMBED elements, which are typically used to include plugins, and sometimes images, media, or frames, are handled. NOTE: Plugins may not work without original server environment, and could cause a security hazard.

• Save: Save the referenced resources to local.
• Link: Link the EMBED element to its source URL. Note that a network flow will be triggered when browsing the captured document in the future.
• Blank: Disable the EMBED element.
• Remove: Remove the EMBED element. Note that this could alter the web page layout.

OptionCaptureFaviconTooltip.message:
This determines how favicons, which are shown in the tab, bookmarks or my favorites, are handled.

• Save: Save the referenced favicon resources to local.
• Link: Link the favicon to its source URL. Note that a network flow will be triggered when browsing the captured document in the future.
• Blank: Disable the favicon.
• Remove: Remove the favicon element.

OptionCaptureFontTooltip.message:
This determines how fonts are handled.

• Save: Save all fonts to local.
• Save used: Save only the fonts used by elements in the captured web page area. If the captured page is not displayed (such as capture source), all fonts are still saved. NOTE: This requires a complex computation and may be erroneous or resource-consuming for certain complicated web pages.
• Link: Link the font to its source URL. Note that a network flow will be triggered when browsing the captured document in the future.
• Blank: Clear fonts from the stylesheets.

OptionCaptureFormStatusTooltip.message:
This determines how current form status are handled.

• Save all: Record the current status using special attributes and an initialization script, to avoid breaking features like reset.
• Save: Record the current status (excluding sensitive information like passwords) using special attributes and an initialization script, to avoid breaking features like reset.
• Keep all: Rewrite the current status with corresponding HTML attributes, and non-HTML representable properties are recorded with special attributes and an initialization script.
• Keep: Rewrite the current status (excluding sensitive information like passwords) with corresponding HTML attributes, and non-HTML representable properties are handled with special attributes and an initialization script.
• Keep all HTML: Rewrite the current status with corresponding HTML attributes, ignoring non-HTML representable properties.
• Keep HTML: Rewrite the current status (excluding sensitive information like passwords) with corresponding HTML attributes, ignoring non-HTML representable properties.
• Reset: Ignore the current status.

OptionCaptureFrameTooltip.message:
This determines how frames (FRAME and IFRAME elements) are handled.

• Save: Save the frame pages to local.
• Link: Link the frame to its source URL. Note that a network flow will be triggered when browsing the captured document in the future. NOTE: Due to the restriction of SOP, ths font cannot be loaded by the captured page unless CORS has been properly configured by its source server.
• Blank: Disable the frame elements.
• Remove: Remove the frame. Note that this could alter the web page layout.

OptionCaptureHelpersTooltip.message:
Capture helpers preprocess the captured content to improve the capture quality. It's defined using JSON syntax with the following format:

  [
    {
      "name": "AdsRemover",
      "description": "Remove unwanted content",
      "pattern": "/^https?://example\\.com//i",
      "commands": [
        ["remove", "#ad-by-xxx"],
        ["unwrap", "#i-want-to-strip-this"],
        ...
      ]
    },
    {
      "name": "DeferredImageFixer",
      "description": "Save deferred images defined by data-*",
      "commands": [
        ["attr", {"css": "img[data-src]"}, "src", ["get_attr", null, "data-src"]],
        ["attr", {"css": "img[data-srcset]"}, "srcset", ["get_attr", null, "data-srcset"]],
        ...
      ]
    },
    {
      "description": "Don't capture images on this site",
      "pattern": "/^https?://example\\.com//i",
      "options": {
        "capture.image": "blank",
        "capture.imageBackground": "blank"
      }
    },
    ...
  ]

• name: a string to name this helper and can be used in debugging identification, optional.
• description: a string to annotate this helper, optional.
• disabled: disables this helper when the value is truthy, optional.
• debug: enable debug mode for this helper when the value is truthy, optional.
• pattern: a regular expression string (“/expression/flags”; same for followings) to restrict URLs this helper works for. Works for all pages when omitted.
• options: overriding capture options, with the same format as the exported options (limited to “capture.*”).
• commands: Commands to run in order.
  • Available commands are:
    • ["html", selector, htmlText, isOuter]: for each element matched by selector, set HTML content to htmlText. Set outer HTML instead if isOuter is truthy.
    • ["text", selector, text]: for each element matched by selector, set text content to text.
    • ["attr", selector, name, value]: for each element matched by selector, set attribute name to value (or null to delete attribute).
    • ["attr", selector, [[name1, value1], [name2, value2], ...]]: for each element matched by selector, set multiple attributes.
    • ["attr", selector, {name1: value1, name2: value2, ...}]: for each element matched by selector, set multiple attributes.
    • ["css", selector, name, value, priority]: for each element matched by selector, set CSS property name to value (or null to delete property) with priority ("important" or "" or omitted).
    • ["css", selector, [[name1, value1, priority1], [name2, value2, priority2], ...]]: for each element matched by selector, set multiple CSS properties.
    • ["css", selector, {name1: value1, name2: value2, ...}]: for each element matched by selector, set multiple CSS properties.
    • ["remove", selector]: remove each node matched by selector.
    • ["unwrap", selector]: unwrap (remove but keep child nodes) each node matched by selector.
    • ["insert", selector, nodeData, mode, index]: for each node matched by selector as reference, insert a node defined by nodeData, with insertion method specified by mode and index.
      • nodeData can be a string (to insert a text node) or a selector (JSON object), or a JSON object with following properties:
        • name: name of the element node (e.g. “span”), or “#text” for a text node, or “#comment” for a comment node.
        • value: value (text content) of the node.
        • attrs: attributes of the element node, as [[name1, value1], [name2, value2], ...] or {name1: value1, name2: value2, ...}.
        • children: child nodes of the element node, as [nodeData1, nodeData2, ...].
      • mode can be:
        • "before": insert before the reference node.
        • "after": insert after the reference node.
        • "insert": insert as the index-th child node of the reference element node (starting from 0).
        • "append" (default): insert as the last child node of the reference element node.
        • "replace": replace the reference node.
    • ["isolate", selector]: remove every node other than which matches selector and their ancestors and descendants. For HTML documents, nodes outside the BODY element (such as the HEAD element) are not affected.
    • ["for", selector, command1, command2, ...]: for each node matched by selector, run command# in order.
  • A parameter of a command can also be a command, and below commands can be used to get a value:
    • ["has_node", selector]: whether selector matches at least one node.
    • ["has_attr", selector, name]: whether the first element matched by selector has the attribute name.
    • ["get_html", selector, isOuter]: HTML content of the first element matched by selector. Get outer HTML instead if isOuter is truthy.
    • ["get_text", selector]: text content of the first element matched by selector.
    • ["get_attr", selector, name]: value of attribute name of the first element matched by selector.
    • ["get_css", selector, name, getPriority]: value of style name of the first element matched by selector. Get style priority instead if getPriority is truthy.
    • ["match", text, pattern, group]: whether text matches the regular expression string pattern. If group is an integer or string, return the corresponding subgroup of the match (0 for the matched string).
    • ["replace", text, pattern, replacement]: result of the string text with regular expression pattern replaced with replacement.
    • ["if", cond, thenValue, elseValue]: return thenValue if cond is truthy, or elseValue otherwise.
    • ["equal", value1, value2, strict]: whether value1 and value2 are equal. If strict is truthy, their types are also required to be identical.
    • ["and", value1, value2, ...]: return the first falsy value in value#, or the last value.
    • ["or", value1, value2, ...]: return the first truthy value in value#, or the last value.
    • ["concat", value1, value2, ...]: concatenate multiple string values.
    • ["slice", text, beginIndex, endIndex]: return the extracted substring from beginIndex to endIndex of the string text.
    • ["upper", text]: text with letters converted to upper case.
    • ["lower", text]: text with letters converted to lower case.
    • ["encode_uri", text, safe]: percent-encode the string text to be used in a URI, with every char in string safe excluded from encoding.
    • ["decode_uri", text]: decode the percent-encoded string text.
    • ["add", value1, value2, ...]: arithmetic addition of value1 + value2 + ....
    • ["subtract", value1, value2, ...]: arithmetic subtraction of value1 - value2 - ....
    • ["multiply", value1, value2, ...]: arithmetic multiplication of value1 * value2 * ....
    • ["divide", value1, value2, ...]: arithmetic division of value1 / value2 / ....
    • ["mod", value1, value2, ...]: arithmetic modulo operation of value1 % value2 % ....
    • ["power", value1, value2, ...]: arithmetic exponentiation of value1 ^ value2 ^ ....
  • A selector can be specified in many commands to select nodes according to the current reference node. The reference node of each command of commands is initially the root node of the captured page (which is usually the HTML element). Each node matched by the selector of a command will become the reference node of the selector of every command of a parameter following the selector parameter. The value of a selector can be either:
    • A JSON object with following properties:
      • base: a string that resets the reference node for this selector, whose value can be:
        • "self": the current reference node.
        • "root": the root node of the current reference node.
        • "parent": the parent of the current reference node.
        • "previousSibling": the previous sibling of the current reference node.
        • "nextSibling": the next sibling of the current reference node.
        • "firstChild": the first child of the current reference node.
        • "lastChild": the last child of the current reference node.
        • Values above can be concatenated with ".". For example, "firstChild.nextSibling.nextSibling" represents the third child node.
      • css: match nodes using the CSS selector string.
      • xpath: match nodes using the XPath string.
      • If no selector like css or xpath is specified, return a node list containing only the reference node.
    • A string: interpreted as {"base": <string_value>} if the value is a valid base value described above; otherwise as {"css": <string_value>}.
    • Other value: return a node list containing only the reference node.
  • When debug mode is enabled, commands with name prefixed with “*” will be logged in the console. For example: ["*get_attr", null, "data-src"]

When an error occurs or debug mode is enabled, details are available in the console of the captured page (or the capture dialog whening capturing source).

OptionCaptureImageBackgroundTooltip.message:
This determines how style images (images of background, cursor, list-item, etc., used by the stylesheet, and the background attribute of an element in old HTML standard) are handled.

• Save: Save all style images to local.
• Save used: Save only the style images used by elements in the captured web page area. If the captured page is not displayed (such as capture source), all style images are still saved. NOTE: This requires a complex computation and may be erroneous or resource-consuming for certain complicated web pages.
• Link: Link the style image to its source URL. Note that a network flow will be triggered when browsing the captured document in the future.
• Blank: Clear style images from the stylesheets.

OptionCaptureImageTooltip.message:
This determines how images (IMG, PICTURE, and some INPUT elements) are handled.

• Save: Save the referenced image resources to local.
• Save current: Save the displayed image resource to local and ignore alternatives for another screen viewport or resolution. This considerably reduces size but may affect the display effect on another device. If the captured page is not displayed in the browser (such as capture source), all images are saved.
• Link: Link the image to its source URL. Note that a network flow will be triggered when browsing the captured document in the future.
• Blank: Disable the image.
• Remove: Remove the image element. Note that this could alter the web page layout.

OptionCaptureInsertInfoBarLabel.message: Add infobar when a page is captured or saved

OptionCaptureInsertInfoBarTooltip.message:
If checked, a script will be inserted in a captured or saved page to show an infobar at page top (requires JavaScript).

• NOTE: Archive page viewer cannot show the infobar as it does not support JavaScript. Use a viewing technique that supports JavaScript to work with an archive page, such as opening the index page after unzipping.

OptionCaptureLinkUnsavedUriTooltip.message: If checked, an uncaptured resource is linked to the source URL (a network flow will be triggered when browsing the captured document); otherwise it's recorded as “urn:scrapbook:*”.

OptionCaptureMergeCssResourcesTooltip.message: Replace duplicated CSS media with variables. This can significantly reduce file size, but is only supported by modern browsers, such as Chromium ≥ 49, Firefox ≥ 31, Edge ≥ 15, Safari > 9.1, and Opera ≥ 36; other browsers won't be able to show related media.

OptionCaptureNoscriptTooltip.message:
This determines how NOSCRIPT elements are handled. A NOSCRIPT element is shown when the browser does not or has disabled scripts, and typically shows a warning that the browser does not support scripts, or redirects to another page without script requirement. Consider remove such contents when scripts are not captured.

• Save: Keep NOSCRIPT elements.
• Blank: Blank NOSCRIPT elements.
• Remove: Remove NOSCRIPT elements.

OptionCaptureObjectTooltip.message:
This determines how OBJECT elements, which are typically used to include plugins, and sometimes images, media, or frames, are handled. NOTE: Plugins may not work without original server environment, and could cause a security hazard.

• Save: Save the referenced resources to local.
• Link: Link the OBJECT element to its source URL. Note that a network flow will be triggered when browsing the captured document in the future.
• Blank: Disable the OBJECT element.
• Remove: Remove the OBJECT element. Note that this could alter the web page layout.

OptionCaptureRecordRewritesTooltip.message: Create a corresponding data-* attribute, or HTML or CSS comment to record the original value for every rewriting during the capture process.

OptionCaptureRemoteTabDelayLabel.message: Delay before capturing an auto new tab (ms):

OptionCaptureRemoveHiddenTooltip.message:
Determines how hidden elements are handled.

• Disable: Disable this feature.
• Remove undisplayed elements: Remove elements whose “display” CSS property is computed to “none”. An ad-blocker tool may inject hidden CSS to hide ad elements, and this helps truly remove them. Note that this could alter the web page layout, such as altering the targets of “+”, “~”, and “:nth-child” CSS selectors.

OptionCaptureResourceSizeLimitLabel.message: Size limit for each resource file (MiB):

OptionCaptureResourceSizeLimitTooltip.message: A resource file exceeding the limit will not be saved. Empty for no limit.

OptionCaptureRewriteCssTooltip.message:
This determines how stylesheets are rewritten.

• No rewrite: Save stylesheets as-is.
• Rewrite URL: Rewrite URLs in the stylesheets to get them link to downloaded resources correctly.
• Tidy: Rewrite URLs and tidy stylesheets, by removing comments, spaces, and style declarations not recognized by the browser. This helps reduce size, but may cause the page not shown correctly on another browser.
• Advanced tidy: Rewrite URLs, tidy stylesheets, and remove style declarations that is not used by the captured page. This helps further reduce size, but may cause the page not shown correctly on another browser, and could conflict with the saved scripts. NOTE: This requires a complex computation and may be erroneous or resource-consuming for certain complicated web pages.

OptionCaptureSaveAsTooltip.message:
This determines how the web page and referenced files are saved.

• Folder: Generates a folder and save the web page and resource files into it. NOTE for Google Chrome (and some Chromium-based browsers): When saving captured data to scrapbook folder, it's recommended that “Ask where to save each file before downloading” browser option (Advanced > Downloads) be unchecked to avoid massive prompts for each capture. Certain files (e.g. *.js, *.py) may be blocked by the browser, and selecting “Keep” for each one is required to download them.
• HTZ or MAFF package: Packs web page and referenced resources in to a single file using ZIP algorithm. Such files can be viewed using the “View archive page” feature, through the backend server, or by unzipping them.
• Single HTML: Stores the referenced resource as data URL, which is supported by most browsers, such as Chromium > 0, Firefox > 0, Edge > 0, Safari > 0, Opera ≥ 7.2, and IE ≥ 8 (very limited in IE). NOTE: Data URLs are less performant and cannot effectively deduplicate resources, which can cause the file size to increase significantly. Additionally, this format may be incapable of preserving certain complicated data structure.

OptionCaptureSaveAsciiFilenameTooltip.message: The captured file will have non-ASCII chars in the filename encoded.

OptionCaptureSaveDataUriAsFileTooltip.message: A filename will be auto-generated according to the MIME type and the SHA-1 hash of the content of the data URL.

OptionCaptureSaveFileAsHtmlTooltip.message: Save a browser-viewable non-HTML file as an HTML web page.

OptionCaptureSaveFilenameMaxLenUtf16Labe.message: Max length for filename to save (UTF-16 bytes):

OptionCaptureSaveFilenameMaxLenUtf16Tool.message:
Truncate a filename whose length exceeds the specified bytes in UTF-16 encoding. 

• Windows usually uses UTF-16 for filename encoding and has a restriction of max filename length of 255 bytes and max file path length of 260 bytes.

OptionCaptureSaveFilenameMaxLenUtf8Label.message: Max length for filename to save (UTF-8 bytes):

OptionCaptureSaveFilenameMaxLenUtf8Toolt.message:
Truncate a filename whose length exceeds the specified bytes in UTF-8 encoding. 

• Linux usually uses UTF-8 for filename encoding and has a restriction of max filename length of 255 bytes and max file path length of 4096 bytes.

OptionCaptureSaveFilenameTooltip.message:
This determines the filename (excluding the extension) when saving a capture. A slash “/” can be used to specify a subfolder, e.g. “%create-Y%/%create-m%/%title%”.

Following “%<param>%” template syntaxes are available:
• %% - a literal “%”.
• %id% - the unique identifier of the capture, e.g. “20190301124533216”.
• %id-legacy% - the unique identifier using legacy ScrapBook format, e.g. “20190301204533”.
• %uuid% - generates a random UUID, e.g. “941e4674-d6c7-4709-9703-a1b4359286c6”.
• %title% - page title, or the last URL segment.
• %source% - URL of the source.
• %create% - create time.

The <param> of %source% can be suffixed with “-<subparam>” to get the specific part of a URL. Take “https://example.com:8000/app/search.html?q=foo&page=1#results” for example:
• file: the filename, which is usually the last path segment, e.g. “search.html”.
• page: the page name, which is usually the last path segment with extension removed, e.g. “search”.
• protocol: the protocol, e.g. “https”.
• host: the host, including the hostname and the port, e.g. “example.com:8000”.
• hostname: the hostname, e.g. “example.com”.
• port: the port, e.g. “8000”.
• pathname: the pathname, e.g. “app/search.html”.
• search: the search string, e.g. “q=foo&page=1”.
• search-<name>: the value for the parameter <name> of the search string, e.g. “search-page” gets  “1”.
• hash: the hash value, e.g. “results”.

The <param> of %create% can be suffixed with “-<time_format>” to specify a time format (using POSIX strftime format), and the <time_format> can be suffixed with “-utc” to use UTC time. For example, “%create-F-utc%” outputs something like “2020-04-01”. Below is a list of some frequently used POSIX strftime formats:
• Y: year with 4 digits
• y: year with 2 digits
• m: month with 2 digits (01 to 12)
• d: date of month with 2 digits (01 to 31)
• H: hours with 2 digits (00 to 23)
• M: minutes with 2 digits (00 to 59)
• S: seconds with 2 digits (00 to 59)
• F: date (YYYY-MM-DD)
• T: time (HH:MM:SS)

OptionCaptureSaveResourcesSequentiallyTo.message: When checked, resource files are saved in documet order one by one. This reduces CPU and memory usage and ensures files with identical name are numbered in order, but runs slower.

OptionCaptureSaveToTooltip.message:
This determines how captured data files are managed.

• Backend server: save the captured web page in the configured data directory of a book in the backend server.
• Scrapbook folder: save the captured web page in the scrapbook folder under the <default download folder>.
• File: save the captured web page as a file.

OptionCaptureScrapbookFolderTooltip.message:
The top-level folder scrapbook data are saved in. This is a path under the <default download folder>, such as “WebScrapBook/data”.

• Browser extensions are restricted to download only to the <default download folder>. To specify a folder beyond it, create a symbolic link (or junction point in Windows) targeting to the desired folder under <default download folder>.

OptionCaptureScriptTooltip.message:
This determines how all scripts (including SCRIPT elements, links with javascript: protocol, and dynamic attributes like onclick, etc.) are handled.

• Save: Save the referenced script resource to local. NOTE: The saved script may not run normally and may introduce privacy or security issue as the captured page has left the original server environment and has had partial content rewritten. Besides, saved scripts don't run in the archive page viewer due to a security concern. It is generally recommended to perform a capture source, and set capture options to “save”, “canvas” to “blank”, “form status” to “reset”, “shadow DOMs” to “remove”, “constructed stylesheets” to “remove”,“remove hidden elements” to “disable”, and “rewrite styles” to non-“advanced tidy”, to reduce the chance of a conflict with the script.
• Link: Link the script to its source URL. Note that a network flow will be triggered when browsing the captured document in the future.
• Blank: Disable the script.
• Remove: Remove the script element.

OptionCaptureShadowDomTooltip.message:
This determines how shadow DOMs are handled. A shadow DOM is another set of DOM attached to an element in the page by scripts.

• Save: Record shadow DOMs in a special attribute and create an initialization script to re-generate it on loading.
• Remove: Do not record shadow DOMs.

OptionCaptureStyleTooltip.message:
This determines how stylesheets (including external – some LINK elements – and internal – STYLE elements) are handled.

• Save: Save the referenced external stylesheet resource to local.
• Link: Link the external stylesheet to its source URL. Note that a network flow will be triggered when browsing the captured document in the future.
• Blank: Disable the stylesheet.
• Remove: Remove the stylesheet element.

OptionCaptureVideoTooltip.message:
This determines how video elements are handled.

• Save: Save the referenced video resource to local.
• Save current: Save the playing video resource to local and ignore alternatives for other browsers. This considerably reduces size but the video may be unplayable on another platform. If the captured page is not displayed in the browser (such as capture source), all video resources are saved.
• Link: Link the video to its source URL. Note that a network flow will be triggered when browsing the captured document in the future.
• Blank: Disable the video.
• Remove: Remove the video element. Note that this could alter the web page layout.

OptionCheckerResolveAbsoluteIconLabel.message: Automatically cache icons with absolute URL

OptionCheckerResolveInvalidIdLabel.message: Automatically remove items with invalid ID

OptionCheckerResolveMissingDateLabel.message: Automatically fix items with missing create or modify time

OptionCheckerResolveMissingIndexFileLabe.message: Automatically remove items with missing index file

OptionCheckerResolveMissingIndexLabel.message: Automatically remove items with missing index property

OptionCheckerResolveOlderMtimeLabel.message: Automatically update item modify time if index file has newer last modified time

OptionCheckerResolveTocEmptySubtreeLabel.message: Automatically remove empty sub lists from TOC

OptionCheckerResolveTocInvalidLabel.message: Automatically remove invalid items from TOC

OptionCheckerResolveTocUnreachableLabel.message: Automatically add items unreachable from TOC

OptionCheckerResolveUnindexedFilesLabel.message: Automatically generate items for detected new pages and add them to root TOC

OptionEditorAutoInit.message: Automatically load editor toolbar when visiting a page in the scrapbook

OptionEditorInsertDateFormatTooltip.message:
The inserted date is the current local time, using POSIX strftime format.

Below is a short list of frequently used formats:
• %c: local datetime
• %x: locate date
• %Y: year with 4 digits
• %y: year with 2 digits
• %m: month with 2 digits (01 to 12)
• %B: local full month name
• %b: local abbreviated month name
• %d: date of month with 2 digits (01 to 31)
• %A: local full weekday name
• %a: local abbreviated weekday name
• %X: local time
• %H: hour (24-hour clock) with 2 digits (00 to 23)
• %I: hour (24-hour clock) with 2 digits (00 to 12)
• %p: AM or PM
• %M: minute with 2 digits (00 to 59)
• %S: second with 2 digits (00 to 59)
• %z: local timezone offset
• %Z: local timezone name
• %%: % sign

OptionEditorUseNativeTagsLabel.message: Use native HTML tags for markings

OptionEditorUseNativeTagsTooltip.message: Use native HTML tags for markings to be compatible with old browsers (e.g. IE < 9), but are more likely to be intefered by the original web page and results in an abnormal style.

OptionScrapbookBackupForRecaptureTooltip.message:
Data files of the original capture will be moved to the backup directory configured by the backend server after the capture is done successfully. Uncheck to delete instead of moving to backup directory instead.

• NOTE: Annotations in the original captured page are automatically migrated to the new capture. However, it's possible that some annotations cannot be auto-migrated or even not detected at all, and thus it's generally recommended to leave a backup in case something goes wrong.

OptionScrapbookCopyItemInfoFormatPlainTo.message:
This determines the format of copy info.

Following “%<param>%” template syntaxes are available:
• %% - a literal “%”.
• %id% - item ID.
• %title% - item title.
• %comment% - item comment.
• %source% - item source URL.
• %url% - item URL.
• %create-#% - item create time.
• %modify-#% - item modify time.
• %folder% - folder.
• %path% - folder and title.

The <param> of %create% and %modify% can be suffixed with “-<time_format>” to specify a time format (using POSIX strftime format), and the <time_format> can be suffixed with “-utc” to use UTC time. For example, “%create-F-utc%” outputs something like “2020-04-01”. Below is a list of some frequently used POSIX strftime formats:
• Y: year with 4 digits
• y: year with 2 digits
• m: month with 2 digits (01 to 12)
• d: date of month with 2 digits (01 to 31)
• H: hours with 2 digits (00 to 23)
• M: minutes with 2 digits (00 to 59)
• S: seconds with 2 digits (00 to 59)
• F: date (YYYY-MM-DD)
• T: time (HH:MM:SS)

The <param> may be suffixed with one or more “:<format>”s to transform the output, such as “%title:oneline:escape_html%”. Available values for the <format> are:
• oneline: Truncate linefeed and following chars .
• collapse: Collapse ASCII whitespace chars .
• url: Escape special chars of URL.
• escape_html: Escape special chars of HTML, including “<”, “&”, “>”, and “"”.
• escape_html_space: Escape special chars of HTML, and convert continuous white spaces into “ ”s.
• escape_css: Escape special chars of CSS.
• json: Convert to a JSON string.

OptionScrapbookDefaultSearchTooltip.message: The prefilled search condition. For example, setting this to “-type:separator” makes “keyword” in the search field mean searching “-type:separator keyword”.

OptionScrapbookExportNonSingletonLabel.message: Export: include duplicated items at another position

OptionScrapbookImportResolveItemUsedNewL.message: Import: generate a new item for an existing one

OptionScrapbookScrapbookSearchCommentLen.message: Comment length shown in search results:

OptionScrapbookScrapbookSearchContextLen.message: Context length shown in search results:

OptionScrapbookScrapbookSearchSourceLeng.message: Source length shown in search results:

OptionScrapbookSidebarInNewTabLabel.message: Open new tab for sidebar operations:

OptionServerPasswordTooltip.message:
If the backend server is configured to require HTTP authorization, the password can be provided here to prevent being asked for repeatedly.

• NOTE: Credentials stored in a browser extension is unprotected and could be stolen by a skilled attacker. Using password-protected built-in browser password manager is generally more preferable.

OptionServerUrlTooltip.message:
The root URL path (which must ends with “/”) of the backend server application, such as “https://example.com/wsb/”.

• The backend server can be hosted using PyWebScrapBook (minimal compatible version: $BACKEND_VERSION$). See https://pypi.org/project/webscrapbook/ for further details.
• The default address of a local PyWebScrapBook backend server is “http://localhost:8080/”, if not otherwise configured.

OptionServerUserTooltip.message:
If the backend server is configured to require HTTP authorization, the user name can be provided here to prevent being asked for repeatedly.

• NOTE: Credentials stored in a browser extension is unprotected and could be stolen by a skilled attacker. Using password-protected built-in browser password manager is generally more preferable.

OptionUiAutoCloseCaptureDialogNoWarnLabe.message: If no warning, error, or failure

OptionUiNotifyPageCapturedLabel.message: Show hint when browsing a page having been captured

OptionUiNotifyPageCapturedTooltip.message:
When checked, a badge number of matching items will be shown at the toolbar button, with different color for the matching level: 
• red: same URL (excluding the #-part)
• yellow: same path (excluding the ?- and #-part)
• green: same site (same protocol, domain, and port)
• blue: same domain (e.g. https: and http: or www.example.com and example.com are considered same)
• gray: same URL captured during the current browser session

OptionViewerViewAttachmentsTooltip.message: Attachments (files with “Content-Disposition: attachment” HTTP header) are normally downloaded directly without an attempt to open by the browser. Check this option to force opening archive page files that are attachments using the archive page viewer.

OptionViewerViewHtzTooltip.message: When the browser loads an HTZ file, view it with the viewer. Check “Allow access to file URLs” in a supported browser to enable opening such files directly.

OptionViewerViewMaffTooltip.message: When the browser loads a MAFF file, view it with the viewer. Check “Allow access to file URLs” in a supported browser to enable opening such files directly.

PermissionHostDesc.message: Host access permission of all sites (which can be configured in the extension manager) are required; otherwise a failure may occur when capturing a web page or resource, or when connecting to the configured backend server.

PermissionWebRequestBlockingDesc.message:
Some browsers require an extension be force-installed to grant web request blocking permission, without which may:
• Being unable to send an appropriate referrer, which might be checked by the website for access control, causing some web pages or resources not captured properly.
• Being unable to redirect to the viewer when visiting an archive file, which will be downloaded as a normal ZIP file instead.

To force install an extension:
• Windows: Open Windows Registry Editor (regedit) and add a new string value:
  • Google Chrome: {main_key}\SOFTWARE\Policies\Google\Chrome\ExtensionInstallForcelist\{num} = {extension_id}
  • Microsoft Edge: {main_key}\SOFTWARE\Policies\Microsoft\Edge\ExtensionInstallForcelist\{num} = {extension_id}
  • Chromium: {main_key}\SOFTWARE\Policies\Chromium\ExtensionInstallForcelist\{num} = {extension_id}
  Where {main_key} can be either HKEY_CURRENT_USER (for the current user) or HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE (for all users), {num} is any integer, and {extension_id} can be found in the extension management page.
  Exit the browser through the menu (to ensure shutting down background processes) and restart it after done. When successfully configured, the extension should be installed and cannot be disabled, and the policy can be found at chrome://policy/ page.
• For configuration for another operating system or browser, see the official documentation:
  • Google Chrome: https://chromeenterprise.google/intl/en_us/policies/#ExtensionInstallForcelist
  • Microsoft Edge: https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/DeployEdge/microsoft-edge-policies#extensioninstallforcelist

PermissionWebRequestBlockingSummary.message: Web request blocking permission not granted

ScrapBookCommandCopyDialogRoot.message: Copy into the item of this ID:

ScrapBookCommandDeleteConfirm.message: Are you sure to permanently delete the $NUM$ item(s)?

ScrapBookCommandMoveDialogId.message: Move into the item of this ID:

ScrapBookErrorBookNotExist.message: Scrapbook $NAME$ does not exist. Reset to default scrapbook.

ScrapBookErrorServerTreeChanged.message: Tree data in the server has been changed. Refresh the page and try again.

ScrapBookErrorSourceTreeOutdated.message: Tree data of the source page is outdated. Refresh that page and try again.

ScrapBookNewFolderName.description: Default name of a new folder

ScrapBookNewNoteName.description: Default name of a new note

ScrapBookNoTree.message: This scrapbook is configured to work without an index tree. Visit the index page using the “View index page” command. Manage data using the file manager or the web interface of the backend server.

ViewerDesc.message: Pick HTZ or MAFF archive files to open, via dropping them into this window, or using the buttons below:

WarnCaptureCircular.message: Resource '$SOURCE$' has a circular reference to '$TARGET$', which will be blanked because current capture configuration does not support circular reference.

WarnSearchCacheMissing.message: Scrapbook “$BOOK$” doesn't have a fulltext cache. Click me to build one and then refresh this page.

WarnSearchCacheOutdated.message: Scrapbook “$BOOK$” seems to have an outdated fulltext cache. Click me to update it and then refresh this page.

WarnSidebarLoginPromptMissing.message: Click me to login and refresh this page if the browser doesn't prompt for login.
